author: Chandra Philip
description: Nova Scotia RCMP have said they are scaling back the search for two young children who were first reported missing on May 2. Lily Sullivan, 6, and Jack Sullivan, 4, were reported missing to police around 10 a.m. that day. The duo are believed to have wandered off from their home in Pictou County, police […]
title: Search for Nova Scotia Missing Children Being Scaled Back: RCMP

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Canada’s top energy CEOs have penned an open letter to Prime Minister Mark Carney, asking him to get rid of the emissions cap on oil and gas producers and repeal industrial carbon pricing in order to build Canada’s economy. The leaders of 38 companies said in their April 30 letter that the country’s oil and […]
title: Energy CEOs Call for Carney to Scrap Emissions Cap, Industrial Carbon Tax

author: The Canadian Press
description: British Columbia Premier David Eby says resolving the softwood lumber dispute could create “momentum” for a larger trade agreement between Canada and the United States. Eby says he and several other premiers pressed that point when they met virtually with Prime Minister Mark Carney for the first time following his meeting with U.S. President Donald […]
title: BC Premier Says Softwood Lumber Accord Could Build ‘Momentum’ for US Trade Deals

author: The Canadian Press
description: Over 800 special ballots cast during the recent federal election were mistakenly kept at the office of a returning officer in B.C., Elections Canada says. The agency says all registered political parties have been informed that 822 special ballots cast by electors in 74 electoral districts across the country were left with the returning officer […]
title: Over 800 Special Ballots ‘Mistakenly’ Kept in BC Riding, Elections Canada Says

author: Eva Fu
description: 'We need a penalty that's commensurate with the crime and the crime is outrageous,' said lead sponsor Rep. Chris Smith (R-N.J.)
title: House Overwhelmingly Passes Stop Forced Organ Harvesting Act

author: The Canadian Press
description: The British Columbia government has appointed a former chief justice of the B.C. Supreme Court to report on safety measures for event organizers and police after 11 people were killed in a vehicle attack in Vancouver. Premier David Eby says Christopher Hinkson has agreed to serve as commissioner to conduct the review “in a very […]
title: BC Government Appoints Former Chief Justice Review Festival Safety Measures

author: Matthew Horwood
description: News Analysis Prime Minister Mark Carney has brought the Liberal Party back from the brink of electoral defeat, securing re-election and three seats shy of a majority in the House of Commons. But with the election over, the real work of effective governing is now before the prime minister, amid numerous challenges. Here’s a look […]
title: Challenges Facing Carney Post-Election

author: The Canadian Press
description: Canada’s largest school board says it has received a ransom demand over student data that was stolen last December, even though the company behind the affected software paid ransom in hopes of securing that information. The Toronto District School Board said in a letter to parents and caregivers on Wednesday that it recently learned the […]
title: Toronto District School Board Says It Got a Ransom Demand Over Stolen Student Data

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Military Exercises in India, Strikes on Yemen, and Golden Snub-Nosed Monkeys

author: Noé Chartier
description: News Analysis There’s a wide range of perspectives on Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney’s performance during his meeting with U.S. President Donald Trump in the Oval Office, ranging from complete success to utter failure. The assessment of Carney’s performance during the White House meeting on May 6 is inherently subjective and varies based on who […]
title: How Did Carney Perform in His First Meeting With Trump?

author: Jill McLaughlin
description: The resort will join parks built by Warner Bros. and Ferrari on Yas Island in the United Arab Emirates.
title: Disney Announces New Theme Park to Be Built in Abu Dhabi

author: Venus Upadhayaya
description: Chinese-made satellite phones were found at the site of the deadly terror attack that killed 26 tourists on April 22.
title: China’s Footprint Is Clear in Kashmir Crisis, Analysts Say

author: The Canadian Press
description: One of Canada’s oldest veterans, Burdett Sisler, says it’s not that hard to make it to 110 years old—all you have to do is stay alive. “Anybody can do it,” the supercentenarian said in a recent interview. “I don’t feel any different as any other day really, except I can’t move as fast or think […]
title: ‘Every Day Is Fun Because I’m Still Alive,’ Says 110-Year-Old Canadian Veteran

author: Matthew Horwood
description: White House official Stephen Miller says U.S. President Donald Trump has helped to secure a new trade and defence relationship with Canada, following the first meeting between Trump and Prime Minister Mark Carney. “President Trump has opened up a completely new relationship with Canada because of his strength and because of his diplomacy,” Miller said […]
title: Senior Trump Official Credits President for ‘New Relationship’ With Canada

author: Nathan Su
description: The WHO’s highest decision-making body has excluded Taiwan from participation since 2017 amid political pressure from the Chinese Communist Party.
title: Taiwanese Officials and Community Leaders in California Urge WHO to Include Taiwan

author: Tom Ozimek
description: The new partnership aims to boost military cooperation as the United States pushes Europe to shoulder more responsibility for its own defense.
title: France and Germany Launch Joint Security Council as Europe Seeks More Self-Reliance

author: Chandra Philip
description: A bill to add gender expression to the Manitoba Human Rights Code could infringe on free speech and requires changes and clarification on its parameters, the Opposition PC Party says. Bill 43, known as The Human Rights Code Amendment Act, aims to add gender expression to section 9, which defines characteristics protected from discrimination. Manitoba’s […]
title: Manitoba PCs Call for Changes to Bill Adding Gender Expression to Human Rights Code

author: Bill Pan
description: The United States has moved to withdraw from a trade agreement that's crucial to Mexico's tomato export.
title: Mexico’s Agriculture Chief Meets With US Officials as Tomato Trade Dispute Looms

author: Owen Evans
description: The European Commission is taking the Czech Republic, Spain, Cyprus, Poland, and Portugal to court for not designating Digital Services Act enforcers.
title: EU Taking Legal Action Against Member States for Not Enforcing Internet Policing Law

author: The Canadian Press
description: A new court filing says several bids have been received for Hudson’s Bay assets, but no offers have come from company insiders. An affidavit from Jennifer Bewley, chief financial officer of the retailer’s parent company, indicates no insiders submitted a bid for the business or its assets by the April 30 deadline. The Bankruptcy and […]
title: Hudson’s Bay Insiders Not Bidding on Business, Assets or Leases: Court Documents

author: Guy Birchall
description: Friedrich Merz made a visit to Paris to meet with French President Emmanuel Macron to discuss a range of issues, including tariffs and security.
title: Merz Calls for European Unity on First Trip as German Chancellor

author: Adam Morrow
description: The trip gives a diplomatic boost to Ahmed al-Sharaa and his interim government, which has yet to be formally recognized by Washington.
title: Syrian Leader Visits Paris for Talks With Macron in 1st Official Trip to Europe

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Asthma-related emergency room visits substantially increased across Ontario during the 2023 wildfires in Canada, a new study says. A report released by the Canadian Medical Association Journal (CMAJ) on May 5 noted that hospital visits for asthma spiked during the first wave of wildfire smoke in early June 2023. The number of visits reduced during […]
title: Spike in Hospital Visits for Asthma Linked to Wildfire Smoke: Study

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The Alberta government is implementing new measures to manage escalating measles outbreaks in the province, as case counts spike to levels not seen since 1987. The province announced 42 active cases as of May 6, bringing the total to 287 since the onset of the outbreaks in March. It is the highest case count in […]
title: Alberta Strengthens Measles Protection as Cases Approach 1980s Highs

author: Travis Gillmore
description: The vice president highlighted the need to boost industrialization to bolster economic and regional security.
title: Vance Calls for European Self-Sufficiency in Address to World Leaders

author: Ryan Morgan
description: An F-18 Super Hornet hit the sea while trying to land on the USS Harry S. Truman on May 6, just days after a similar incident.
title: US Navy Fighter Jet Lost Overboard From Aircraft Carrier Truman

author: The Canadian Press
description: New rules on tipping and on price displays at grocery retailers are in effect as of today across Quebec. Tips must now be calculated on the price before taxes, and tipping options must be “neutral and uniform,” so that a merchant can’t suggest a percentage that a client should give. Also, grocery retailers will now […]
title: New Rules on Tipping, Price Labelling Take Effect Across Quebec

author: The Canadian Press
description: There is no evidence to support claims of a mystery brain disease in New Brunswick, says a new study that suggests the media may have played a role in feeding patients’ fears. Published Wednesday in the journal JAMA Neurology, the study reviewed the cases of 25 patients evaluated at two hospitals in New Brunswick and […]
title: Study Finds No Evidence to Support New Brunswick’s Mystery Brain Disease

author: Jack Phillips
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio says top administration officials are speaking with both sides and urging de-escalation.
title: Trump Calls India–Pakistan Tensions ‘a Shame,’ Says He Hopes for a Quick End

author: The Canadian Press
description: Defence lawyers are continuing to cross-examine the complainant today at the trial of five former members of Canada’s world junior hockey team. One of the lawyers representing Michael McLeod suggested Tuesday the complainant asked to bring other players into a London, Ont., hotel room after she had sex with McLeod, and later invited them to […]
title: Defence in Hockey Players’ Sex Assault Trial Continues Cross-Examining Complainant

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Canadians are increasingly anxious about food affordability with many predicting prices will continue to rise in the year ahead as trade tensions with the United States persist, a new report suggests. Nearly 85 percent of Canadians who participated in the Canadian Food Sentiment Index published this week by Dalhousie University’s Agri-Food Analytics Lab say food […]
title: Canadians Preparing for Rising Food Prices Amid US Trade Tensions: Report

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The appeal comes as demonstrators plan to rally outside the Indian High Commission in London in a show of support for Pakistan.
title: UK Urges Calm as India–Pakistan Crisis Stirs Concerns at Home

author: Chris Summers
description: India said no Pakistani military installations had been hit and that 'considerable restraint' had been used in the selection of targets.
title: Pakistan Threatens to Respond After Indian Air Strikes Kill 26

author: Chandra Philip
description: The B.C. Court of Appeal has dismissed an appeal of the province’s COVID vaccine mandate for health-care workers. In a May 6 hearing, the court dismissed the appeal on the grounds it was moot, or no longer relevant. Allison Pejovic, a constitutional lawyer representing the health-care workers, said she was disappointed by the decision, telling […]
title: BC Court of Appeal Dismisses Health-Care Workers’ COVID Vaccine Mandate Challenge

author: Guy Birchall
description: The European Commission is moving to ban the enforcement of existing contracts by 2027 and the signing of new ones this year.
title: EU Proposes to End Russian Gas Imports by 2027

author: The Canadian Press
description: U.S. Ambassador to Canada Pete Hoekstra will make his first official appearance at the B7 Summit in Ottawa next week. The Canadian Chamber of Commerce is hosting the B7 Summit this year, an annual gathering of business leaders from the G7 countries. Hoekstra was sworn in as Ambassador to Canada on April 15 in Washington, […]
title: US Ambassador Pete Hoekstra Will Make His First Appearance at Business Summit

author: Epoch Video
description: Vice President JD Vance attends the Munich Leaders Meeting and participates in a discussion hosted by the Munich Security Conference, in Washington at 9:30 a.m. ET on May 7.
title: Vance Attends Munich Leadership Meeting on Security

author: The Canadian Press
description: British Columbia’s worker protection agency says a planned burn by the province’s wildfire service during the devastating 2023 fire season could have killed or injured multiple firefighters who became “trapped by extreme fire behaviour” that cut off their escape. Inspection reports by WorkSafeBC say the BC Wildfire Service didn’t adequately ensure safety during the burn […]
title: Planned Burn Could Have Killed Trapped Firefighters, Says BC Safety Report

author: The Canadian Press
description: Alert Ready, Canada’s emergency public alerting system, will be put to the test today. The alert and its distinctive tone will be broadcast on TV, radio, and some compatible wireless devices. Each province or territory has a specific test time, ranging from morning to afternoon, except Quebec, which does not participate. The test simulates an […]
title: Canada’s Alert Ready System Undergoes Annual Test Today, Coast to Coast, Except Que.

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The 2025 election has been challenging for the left-wing party.
title: Greens Leader Closer to Losing Seat as Labor Leads Count by 4,000 Votes

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Queensland MP Colin Boyce has called on Nationals leader David Littleproud to step aside for another leadership vote.
title: Dutton Confirms Exit, Prefers Not to Weigh in on Liberal Party’s Future

author: Owen Evans
description: 'Adverse macroeconomic developments, continued supply chain challenges, and increased execution, market and operational risks' are an issue, ,Orsted's CEO said.
title: Orsted Halts Work on Giant UK Wind Farm Citing Rising Costs

description: Opposition politicians have criticised a provision in Tuesday’s deal exempting some temporary Indian workers from national insurance payments.

description: Human smuggling that results in death is a crime in the United States that carries a maximum penalty of death or life in prison.

author: PA Media
description: The risk was only found to be increased among certain women with asthma.

description: The Vatican will shut down all mobile phone communication systems within its territory to ensure the security and secrecy of the voting process.

description: Householders are being reminded not to stockpile firewood or ignore the warning signs of termite infestation.

description: Liberal Tim Wilson has claimed victory in the seat of Goldstein, despite Teal MP Zoe Daniel claiming victory on election night.

description: Australia urges citizens to reconsider travel to Pakistan amid high terror threat, unrest, and possible flight disruptions due to airspace closures.

description: 'You could probably use the independent vote to measure the implied competence of the "uniparty,"' political analyst Graham Young said.

author: Grace Coulter
description: In this episode of NTD’s “Profiles of Service,” we sit down with former British Prime Minister Liz Truss, who served as prime minister in 2022. Truss has been in public service since at least 2010, when she entered Parliament. She shared with us the story of how she broke away from ideas so prevalent in […]
title: Former British Prime Minister Liz Truss on Her Journey to Patriotism | NTD’s Profiles of Service

author: Rudy Blalock
description: The former PM will meet PPP candidate Kim Moon-soo to push for a unified run against liberal frontrunner Lee Jae-myung in the June 3 election.

description: The former PM will meet PPP candidate Kim Moon-soo to push for a unified run against liberal frontrunner Lee Jae-myung in the June 3 election.

description: The Baekryeong Art Center had apologized for the cancellation, saying they weren't acting on their own volition: 'The Ministry of Education insisted.'

description: The Baekryeong Art Center had apologized for the cancellation, saying they weren't acting on their own volition: 'The Ministry of Education insisted.'

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: High-profile Greens MP Max Chandler-Mather lost his Brisbane seat of Griffith to Labor, but says he has no regrets about leaving a toxic work environment.
title: ‘Awful, Miserable’ Workplace: Departing Greens MP Claims He’s Pleased to Leave Parliament

author: Chandra Philip
description: A record number of complaints were submitted to the CBC ombudsman during the recent federal election campaign. Ombudsman Maxime Bertrand said her office received a higher number of complaints in April than in the “previous three months combined.” Bertrand identified two reasons for the high number of complaints in April. “I believe the flood of […]
title: CBC Ombudsman Receives Record Number of Complaints During Election

author: Michael Zwaagstra
description: Commentary Canadian students are struggling academically. Math scores on the Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA) declined by 35 points from 2003 to 2022, the most recent year of available test data. According to PISA, 20 points is the approximate equivalent of one grade level. Thus, Canadian students are nearly two grade levels behind in […]
title: Michael Zwaagstra: Time to Scrap ‘Discovery Learning’ and Return to Time-Tested Math Instruction

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney underscored the importance of national unity after Alberta Premier Danielle Smith said she would uphold the democratic process if a separation question in the province gains enough support to trigger a referendum. “Canada is stronger when we work together,” Carney told reporters in French on May 6, following his first meeting […]
title: Carney Highlights National Unity as Alberta Considers Separation Referendum If Support Threshold Reached
